comments:
Driver: RC2
Java : Sun Java 1.3.1_07
OS: Solaris
Language: ja_JP.eucJP

Steps
1. Create a folder using DBCS characters
2. Launch the workbench specifying the created DBCS folder as the workspace 
(using ?data option: ./eclipse ?vm /.../.../java ?data /.../.../DBCS directory)
3. Create a new simple project by doing New>File>Other... 
4. Select Simple Project and  click Next
And then, the workspace directory is not shown in the "Directory" field.

Created an attachment (id=4201)
Ref: bitmap file

Created an attachment (id=4202)
Ref: bitmap file

DBCS locales are not supported in pre 1.4.0 virtual machines. Please retry 
withj a 1.4.0 or later VM.
I got the same problem using jre 1.4.1_01.

Please ignore the previous comment(.log info). sorry.

For the reference, this phenomenon did not occur with en_US.UTF-8 encoding. I 
can see the DBCS workspace name in the "Directory" field.

I've confirmed that was not reproducible on Eclipse 3.0 with Sun JVM 1.4.2_04.
Please close this pr.
